She starts working very early in the morning. She goes to the market to stock up on various products: rice, sugar, plantain leaves, fish, bananas, and camu camu (a fruit with a high Vitamin C content). She sells all of these food products in front of her home on a large table.

She does a good job, so her business is highly visited. She has been in this spot for six years, and she has been able to make a good income which she has used to build her home.

In the beginning it was hard to build up a customer base, but with time people started recommending her business because of her good service and delicious food. She hopes to be able to expand her business since she has a great desire for the future to own a tourist restaurant. This will be her fifteenth loan with MFP. Things are going well for her and she is very happy to be part of such a responsible group. 

With the requested 3500 soles, she will buy more groceries wholesale. She will buy rice, oil, condiments, bananas, and also some chairs for her customers’ comfort.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, condiments, and bananas, and to buy some chairs for her customers' comfort.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old single man who has been working in a baking business for 18 years. Ahmad was 11 years old when he started working to make his own living because his parents' financial situation forced him to stop his elementary education and quit childhood life to make his own future.

In 2009, Ahmad started his own business. He opened a Manakish Bakery (traditional Lebanese breakfast, folded dough with special toppings). 
His business is going on just fine, but he needs extra income to increase his business capital and improve his financial situation. That's why he applied for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to buy flour and a refrigerator for his bakery.

Ahmad is highly skilled in his business because of his long experience as a worker. He is working hard on expanding and improving it as much as he can, to make sure that he will have a future brighter than his past.

loans.use: To buy flour and a refrigerator for his bakery.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 36 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Jorge no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Gastronomía, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cau Cau para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su madre, día a día Jorge trabaja en su pequeño negocio de decoración de eventos, Jorge trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus clientes.
Jorge se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de sillas y telas adecuadas para decoración de mesas, sillas y otros; de esta manera Jorge podrá seguir trabajando y esforzándose, a fin de lograr su gran sueño de poder ampliar su negocio y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 36-year-old man. He is single and lives in the city of Pisco. He is kind, hard working and enthusiastic, and has a big desire for self-improvement. Unfortunately, due to the lack of resources and the need to work from a young age, Jorge was unable to study for a degree in cooking which he would have really liked. In his spare time he likes to practice sport and he also cooks a delicious Cau Cau for his family from time to time. 

With a lot of effort, dedication and with his mum's support, Jorge works daily in his small event decoration business. Jorge works from early in the morning and can work for about 12 hours. He feels at ease doing his job and he thinks he is doing well thanks to the kind and respectful way in which he treats his customers.

Jorge is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to this help he will be able to buy chairs and fabric for decorating tables, chairs and others. In this way, Jorge will be able to keep working and striving to reach his goal of expanding his business and providing for his family.

loans.use: To buy chairs and fabric.

loans.name: Moussiratou

texts.fr: Agée de 56ans, Moussiratou est mariée et mère de 03enfants dont deux sont encore à l'université. Le plus a 25ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. Elle a une boutique où elle vend des boîtes de conserve, de l'huile et de divers depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de couvrir les besoins de ses clients, Moussiratou a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Le profit dégagé par ce crédit lui permettra de renforcer son stock de marchandise et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: 56 years old, Moussiratou is married and mother of three children, two of whom are still at university. The oldest is 25 and the youngest is 20. Moussiratou has a store where she has sold jars of jam, oil, and other items for several years, stocking up in one of Benin's markets. With the goal of reinforcing her business and providing for her customers' needs, Moussiratou asking for and received a microloan from Finadex. The profit generated by this loan will allow her to reinforce her merchandise stock and to help with her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 10 25-liter cans of oil, 2 boxes of soap, and 2 boxes of jars of jam.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty, de 23 años, es una mujer honesta, trabajadora y sobre todo muy responsable. Realiza sus actividades laborales junto a su conviviente  Cristián quien se dedica a la soldadura, hace puertas ventanas de metal.  Ellos tienen un hijo;  junto a ellos vive  su hermano y su cuñada  con sus cuatro hijos.
El trabajo de Betty  consiste en el armado de puertas, ventanas, escaleras de estructura metálica que junto a su conviviente  salen a buscar clientes en distintos lugares donde requieran estos servicios. Lleva trabajando 3 años en esta actividad.
Este rubro le brinda muchas ganancias ya que la ciudad empieza a crecer y hay más construcciones  y necesitan de sus servicios en el área de carpintería metálica.
Cada vez los lugares donde los requieren se hace mas distante a su hogar, por ello acaban de comprar un motocarro para transportar sus herramientas de trabajo que son su maquina soldadora, cortadora de fierro y otros implementos. Le gusta de su trabajo porque ama lo que hace, le va muy bien ya que cada vez tiene más clientes y eso le permite estar generando ingresos en cada momento. Espera posteriormente  poder abrir un taller propio y así incrementar sus ganancias  para dar oportunidad de trabajo a otras personas. Este será su préstamo  numero 2 con la institución MFP, le gusta el grupo que forma parte ya que todos se conocen y siempre están al pendiente de lo que le pueda pasar a los otros.
Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, y comprará algunos materiales como  fierros, planchas de aluminio y  equipos que le hacen falta para su trabajo carpintería metálica.
texts.en:
Betty, 23 years old, is an honest, hardworking, and above all, responsible young woman.  She lives with Cristián and makes a living working alongside him, welding metal doors and windows. Betty and Cristián have a son, and they live together with Betty's brother and sister-in-law and their four children. 

Betty works assembling doors, windows, metal staircases, and finding customers that require their services. She has been working in this trade for 3 years. This work results in good earnings for Betty since her city is growing and there is much construction and need for metal carpentry services right now. Her work is lately being contracted from farther and farther way, so Betty recently purchased a large van to transport her work tools: welding torch, metal saw, and other tools. Betty enjoys this work because she loves what she does and she has been very successful in it, getting more and more customers, which keeps her profits growing. She hopes to one day open a metal shop of her own and increase her earnings enough to hire employees and give other people the chance to work as well. 

This is Betty's second loan from MFP. She likes working with this banking group because everyone is familiar with each other and looks out for one another. With the loan of 1200 soles, Betty will buy materials such as metal, aluminum irons, and equipment she needs to complete her work in metallic carpentry.

loans.use: to buy pieces of metal, aluminum irons, and equipment necessary for her metal carpentry work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials needed in the repair shop

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 37 years old, married and the mother of three children. She lives in Garang, Tangub City, where she does hog raising for a living. She has been in this work for 10 years and earns about 5,000 PHP from her work.

She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. In 2009, Lolita joined GDMPC in order to earn enough money to improve her house and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Luong

texts.en: Luong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, thereby increasing sales, and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: St Antoine De Padou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ST ANTOINE DE PADOU est composé de onze personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Zinsi Pauline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Zinsi Pauline est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Etienne. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Zinsi Pauline a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Zinsi Pauline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de sa famille, Zinsi Pauline vend depuis huit ans divers produits et des tissus dans un quartier du Bénin et par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Zinsi Pauline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Zinsi Pauline sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ST ANTOINE DE PADOU. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The ST ANTOINE DE PADOU (Saint Antoine of Padua) group is made up of 11 people who live in the same area. This is the third time that the group is asking for financial assistance from Alidé in order to raise the level of their business. The group's representative, named Zinsi Pauline, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Zinsi Pauline is 38 years old and married to a retailer named Etienne. The couple has two children, both in school and in their care. Zinsi Pauline attended school up to the primary level. Zinsi Pauline lives together with her husband and her children. Together the couple provides for the various needs of the household. To contribute to the various needs of the household, Zinsi Pauline has sold various products and fabric in an area of Benin and by distribution system for eight years. This business allows her to respond without great difficulty to her needs. Zinsi Pauline stocks up in a market in Benin. In seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her working capital and her profits, Zinsi Pauline is asking for a third loan from Alidé together with the other members of the ST ANTOINE DE PADOU group. Their previous loans were repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy fabric and various products.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of four school-aged children from Antequera, Bohol. She has been engaged in a food vending business for more than ten years now. She sells home-cooked food to the people in her place.

Caroline is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, oil, bananas and others. This loan will allow her to cook more food for her to sell thus augmenting her sales and income.

In the future, Caroline hopes of expanding her business and making it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money so that she can support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, oil, bananas and others

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 49-years-old, is a married entrepreneur from Poblacion-4, Clarin with 3 children. She is earning from her transport service business. It was started almost 5 years ago now and she earns 6,000 PHP a month.

To improve business, she borrowed the amount of 9,500 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which she just joined in 2011, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim, 45, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a bus driver. Kim has been running a food stall, selling meals, for four years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying different foods to better satisfy her customers. Kim hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy different foods to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Yélian Assiba Anne

texts.fr: Assiba Anne est âgée de 29ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant âgé de 03ans puis scolarisé dans une école de la place. Spécialisée dans la vente des pagnes, des mèches et des produits cosmétiques depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Soucieuse d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de couvrir les attentes de ses clients, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev afin d'en tirer d'énorme profit et de participer à la scolarisation de son enfant.
texts.en: Assiba Anne is 29 years old. She is married and mother of a three year old child who attends school in a school in the area. Specialist in the sale of pagnes, or colorful wax cloth, hair extensions and other cosmetics for several years, she stocks up in one of Benin's markets. Concerned with increasing her capacity to stock up and meet her customers' needs, she made an appeal to Finadev for financial support in order to make larger profits and provide for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes (colorful wax cloth), 25 hair extensions, and one box of cosmetics.

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Melania, 52 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a vender hot dogs, frijoles cocidos, fresco y mini pulpería, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años. Este ha sido su primer negocio con el cual ha mantenido a sus hijos y a su madre. Se levanta desde muy tempranas horas a preparar los frijoles cocidos para vender y por las tardes alista su carrito de hot dog  y sale a recorrer los barrios de la ciudad de Granada a vender sus productos de esta manera se gana la vida todo los días. 
Está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar frijoles, azúcar, aceite y ropa. Su idea es diversificar su negocio quiere formar una pequeña pulpería y vender ropa durante la época navideña donde aumenta las ventas para el sector comercio y no quiere perder la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos. Su meta es lograr formar una pulpería bien surtida y salir adelante junto con su familia.
texts.en: Melania is 52 years old, married, mother of two children, a merchant, she sells hot dogs, beans and has a mini convenience store, activity that she has done for two years.  This was her first business where she was able to support her children and her mom.  She gets up in the early hours to cook the beans and in the afternoon she gets her hot dog cart ready to go out and walk the neighborhoods of the city of Granada to sell her products.  She earns a living this way every day.  She needs the loan to buy beans, sugar, oil and clothing.  Her idea is to diversify the business and build a small convenience store as well as sell clothing during the Christmas season when the sales go up for the retail industry and she doesn't want to miss the opportunity to increase her revenue.  Her goal is to build a well stocked convenience store and get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil and clothing.

loans.name: Roseline Thècle

texts.fr: Roseline Thècle est âgée de 50ans. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont un est scolarisé. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. Coiffeuse de formation, elle a un atelier où elle exerce son métier et vend des mèches depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. En vue de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la forte demande de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de son enfant.
texts.en: Roseline Thècle is 50 years old. She is married and a mother of four children, one of whom is in school. Her oldest child is 30 and the youngest is 20. A hairdresser by profession, she has a studio where she has practiced her business and sold hair extensions for several years. She stocks up in one of Benin's markets as well as one outside. With an eye to reinforcing her business and satisfying the high demand of her customers, she has asking for and received a microloan from Finadev. This loan will allow her to maximize her profits and assist with her child's education.

loans.use: to buy one hairdryer and two boxes of hair extensions.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha,  de 60 años, es una mujer  alegre y muy esforzada en su trabajo.  Vive en su casa propia que compró junto a su  conviviente Guillermo. Ya que sus hijos son mayores e independientes y viven en lugares distintos. El trabajo de Martha consiste en venta de pan, su esposo prepara estos panes en un horno artesanal hecho con arcilla, los cuales son vendidos luego en la calle, o de puerta en puerta, en el que Martha los transporta en una bandeja de plástico.  Lleva 10 años en este negocio y hasta el momento lo viene realizando en sociedad con  su pareja. Considera rentable ya que este negocio le produce una ganancia de hasta el  50% de lo que invierte. Hace poco hubo una lluvia torrencial que destruyó su horno artesanal, a pesar de esto continua adelante abasteciéndose de panes de otra panadería,  para no perder sus clientes ganados en todo este tiempo. Le va bien ya que tiene muchos clientes que le son muy fieles por que les da un buen producto. Por tanto  espera poder mantener ese ritmo de ventas, y volver a reconstruir un horno más grande que  le  permita crecer en sus ventas. Este será el préstamo numero 19 con la institución  MFP, le gusta mucho su grupo por que siente que son responsables, espera poder seguir yendo bien y seguir trabajando con la institución a quien agradece mucho por la oportunidad que le da de poder sentirse productiva,
Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles  lo invertirá para continuar  con su negocio, comprará pan en mayor  cantidad  para así  crecer en sus ventas, asimismo reparará su horno artesanal para cumplir con sus objetivos.
texts.en: Martha is 60 years old, happy, and hard working. She lives in her own home she bought with her husband, Guillermo. Her children are older and independent and live in different places. Martha sells bread that her husband prepares in their artisan's oven made from clay, then  she sells the bread on the street from door to door from a plastic tray that she carries. She has been doing this for 10 years. She considers the business profitable since she earns up to 50% on top of what she invests in it. A short while ago there was a torrential rain that destroyed her oven, but despite this, she continues to work, purchasing breads from another bakery so she doesn't lose her hard won clients. Everything is going well since she has loyal customers because she brings them quality products. And so, she hopes to maintain this rhythm and build an even bigger oven that will allow her to increase business. This will be the 19th loan she has had from MFP and she likes the group very much because she feels they are responsible. She hopes to continue to do well and continue working with this institution whom she thanks for the opportunity they have given her to feel productive.  With the amount of $975 dollars that she is applying for, she will invest in her business, she will purchase a larger quantity of bread and in this way increase her sales while at the same time repairing her oven in order to achieve her long term goals.

loans.use: purchase bread and repair her artisan oven.

loans.name: Leyla Del Socorro

texts.es:
Leyla, de 54 años, casada. Madre de 5 hijos, de oficio comerciante, habitante de la ciudad de Granada. Es dueña de una pulpería negocio que inicio con dinero que obtuvo trabajando en  Panamá , al regresar al país participo en una rifa la cual gano así logro juntar dinero para poner su pulpería negocio del cual sigue sobreviviendo y ha ayudado a sus hijos a salir adelante, su esposo la apoya con lo que  gana reparando bicicletas. 
Está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar  granos básicos, aceite, carne, pollo, gaseosas, jugos, leche, huevo, pan, café. Pues son productos que se consumen a diario los cuales podrá ofrecer a sus clientes por mayor cantidad. Su expectativa es agregarles más productos nuevos y de mejor calidad a su negocio para atraer más cliente y suplir parte de sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Leyla is 54 years old and married. She has five children and works as a shopkeeper in the city of Granada, where she lives. Leyla owns a small store that she opened up with money she earned while working in Panamá. When she returned to Nicaragua, she participated in a raffle and won enough money to combine with her previous earnings and open up her store. This store, together with her husband's earnings from his bicycle repairs, helps Leyla support her children so they can get ahead. 

Leyla is requesting this loan in order to buy basic grains, oil, meat, chicken, sodas, juices, milk, eggs, bread, and coffee. These are items she sells daily, and she would like to have a better supply to offer her customers. She hopes to offer more products, of newer and better quality, in order to attract more customers and meet some of their needs.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, meat, chicken, sodas, juices, milk, eggs, bread, and coffee.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en: Agustin, 52 years old, is married and has 3 children. He resides in Villa Consuelo, Ozamis City. For the past 10 years, Agustin has operated a fishing business, earning PHP 5,000 monthly. He has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Agustin became a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, he wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, 61 years old, is widowed and has five children. She lives with her children in the town of Msambweni, in the coastal region of Kenya. Mariam takes care of the domestic chores in her home. Five years ago, she decided to help her family financially and started a business selling basic needs products. She now has a retail shop where she offers her customers rice, sugar, a variety of breads, meat, dairy products, groceries, sweets, cleaning materials, etc.

With the goal of gaining more customers, Mariam has requested a loan of 40,000 KES. She plans to use it to purchase medicines for common illnesses, flour, dairy products, cooking fat, cleaning products, school supplies, beverages, etc. Mariam's goal is to strengthen her business because she wants to use the profits to prepare her children academically.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for common illnesses, flour, dairy products, cooking fat, cleaning products, school supplies, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Brigitte Adjovi

texts.fr: Agée de 61ans, Brigitte est mariée et mère de huit enfants dont un est scolarisé. Le âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 40ans et 20ans. Elle vend des céréales, des savons, de spaghetti et de divers depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du bénin et de l'extérieur. Expérimentée dans le commerce, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un appui financier à Finadev en vue de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Le bénéfice généré par cet appui financier lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de son enfant et de subvenir à ses propres besoins.
texts.en: 61 years old, Brigitte is married and a mother of eight children, one of whom is in school. The oldest and youngest are respectively 40 and 20 years old. Brigitte has sold grains, soap, spaghetti, and other items for several years. She stocks up in Benin's markets and those outside of Benin. Experienced in business, she has asked for and received the financial support of Finadev with an eye to reinforcing her buying power and satisfying her customers' demands. The profits generated by this loan will allow her to assist in the schooling of her children and to provide for her own needs.

loans.use: to buy one box of spaghetti, one box of sugar, two bags of manioc flour, three bags of corn, and two bags of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his home.

loans.name: Celestina Gladis

texts.es: La Sra. Celestina tiene 55 años sigue con la misma actividad de la   .  Elaboración de masitas desde hace bastante tiempo, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito, en esta ocasión la Sra. Celestina  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de huevos, harina  e insumos por mayor para elaboración de masas y panes por estas fechas de todos santos esta época se realiza variedad de masas para las distintas mesas y va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar y aumentar su producción.
texts.en: Señora Celestina is 55 years old and continues working in a bakery, making a variety of pastries. She says that she did very well with her previous loan, and now she is requesting another in order to buy eggs, flour, and other ingredients in bulk so she can prepare pastries and breads for the upcoming holiday season. She plans to prepare a variety of goods for all different tastes and tables. With her profits from these sales, Celestina will improve and increase her overall production.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Mi Banquito Group

texts.es: Muy buenos días. El grupo “Mi Banquito” es un grupo conformado por 10 socios trabajadores que se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Nicolás uno de los integrantes  activo tiene 49 años,  casado con 04 hijos la cual sigue apoyando a 02 de ellos. Nicolás como un buen agricultor se dirige diariamente a su chacra donde siembra alfalfa, flores, habas y papa; siguiendo el ejemplo de sus familiares quien también se dedicaba a dicha actividad. Se siente feliz pues gracias a los préstamos de Edaprospo a logrado mejorar su negocio. Seguir creciendo en su negocio es su mayor deseo, ya que esto le permitirá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia. En esta oportunidad solito el crédito para la compra de abono, semillas y pagos de sus trabajadores.  El grupo “Mi Banquito” agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso. Nicolás es el único varón del grupo, se encuentra sentado es el segundo del lado izquierdo y viste casaca ploma.
texts.en: A very big hello.The group "Mi Banquito" is made up of 10 people who work hard everyday to get ahead. Nicolás is one of the active members of the group and is 49 years old, married with four children and he continues to support two of them. Nicolás is a good farmer and goes daily to his small farm where he grows alfalfa, flowers, beans and potatoes; following the example of his family members who also work in agriculture. He is happy because thanks to the loans with Edaprospo he has been able to improve his business. To continue to grow is his biggest desire since this will allow him to offer a better quality of life to his family. With this opportunity he is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and pay his workers. The group "Mi Banquito" is grateful for the loan that has made their progress possible. Nicolás is the only man in the group and is seated second from the left and is wearing a sweat shirt.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and pay his workers.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna, 32 years old, is from the Khoni district of West Georgia. She lives with her husband and two children (5 and 7 years old). Her husband works locally as a joiner and earns a monthly income. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they run a small dairy farm and use the cows' milk in cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local open market. Khatuna also grows nuts on the family-owned land and sells the harvested products for a good price. She works hard to do her best for her family. 

Khatuna wants to make some improvements and repairs to her old house, but does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to cover the costs of house repairs, such as changing windows, painting, etc. This loan will enable Khatuna and her family to have suitable home conditions and to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en: Vergie, 51 years old, is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children. For the past 15 years, Vergie has cultivated rice to sell, earning 2,000 PHP monthly. Vergie is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which she will use to pay for the labor costs in rice harvesting. Vergie joined GDMPC in 2012. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in rice harvesting

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, tiene una hija de 8 años de edad, ella comenzó con su negocio como una fuente de ingresos extras, para que su familia tuviera lo necesario, el horario de venta es de 7:00 am hasta las 10:00am.
 Solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para el negocio como aceite, condimentos, chicharrón,  quesillo, para mejorar su capacidad para la producción de las pupusas y además sus ingresos.
La aspiración de Maria es que su familia tenga una vida adecuada y digna.
texts.en:
Maria sells pupusas (a tradicional Salvadoran dish). She has an 8 year old daughter and started her business as a source of additional income so that her family would have what it needed. Her sales hours are from 7 a.m. until 10 a.m.

She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for her business such as cooking oil, condiments, pork rinds and cheese in order to improve her production output of pupusas and thus her income.

Maria’s aspiration is for her family to have a decent, worthwhile life.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, condiments, pork rinds and cheese.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, a 43-year-old married mother of three sons, lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a business selling gas tanks in front of their house. She started this business 12 years ago.

Thanh is requesting a loan both to expand her current business through the purchase of more gas tanks and to open a food stall to sell noodles in her community. She hopes her business runs smoothly and that the new one will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy gas tanks and open a food stall to sell noodles.

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera is a 60-year-old woman from Dusheti district. She lives with her son and 14-year-old grandson, who goes to school. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have five milk cows. Venera milks cows and produces yogurt, which is sold with milk locally in an open market. Besides this, Venera has 45 hens, and she also sells eggs. 

She is a very hardworking woman and has a rich experience in her business. Venera requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing an additional cow, Venera will be able to increase the income of the family. With increased income their living conditions will be improved. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
This is Bienvenida. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Bienvenida dreams of having another vehicle in the coming years and hopes that her children will have a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese government. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the transportation expense of bringing his harvested organic vegetables and fruits to the capital city, where they can be sold.

loans.name: Gantomor

texts.en: Mr.Gantomor is a 69-year-old man who lives with his wife in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His children are married and have moved out of their parents' house. His wife helps him with the business of growing and selling organic vegetables and fruits. Mr.Gantomor started growing vegetables in 1995 for his family use and then has expanded the volume of vegetables, harvests and sells since 1996. He has been in business for years and has gained a lot of experience in organic vegetable growing and sales. Mr.Gantomor is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to repair his existing storage pit so that he can store enough organic vegetables to sell during winter. He is a responsible, hardworking, and neat man.

loans.use: To repair her storage pit for organic fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Quen

texts.en:
Quen's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She is now requesting a further loan to buy piglets, chickens, and fish to sell from her stall. 

Quen hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy piglets, chickens, and fish.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 17 years. She describes herself as social and a businesswoman. She operates an electronic retail store and butcher shop where she sells both meat and electronic goods. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a potential business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the fluctuation of the cost of electronics and a shortage of meat to sell.

She will use the loan of 41,500 KES to buy a water tank which will be used by her six family members. Her business goal is to expand her butcher and electronic shop within 5 years. This is her seventh loan with SMEP DTM. Previously, she took out a loan of 100,000 KES which she managed to pay back.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for use by her family.

loans.name: Delfines Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama ”Delfines Emprendedores” está conformado por 16 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, feriantes, venta de comida rápida, venta de articulos de aseo, venta de ropa infantil, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo, ubicado en la ciudad de Santiago.
Jocelyn , integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en segunda fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro, lo usa suelto y con chasquillas.
Ella se dedica al rubro de  vendedora de ropa, desde hace 1 año. Se desempeña ofreciendo su mercadería de puerta en puerta, donde su clientela le compra ropa interior, ropa en general para grandes y chicos, zapatos, vende las quincenas  y fines de mes,  dando facilidades de pago a su clientela.
La mercadería que va necesitando se abastece comprando en locales donde encuentra gran variedad de ropa en diferentes colores, modelos y tallas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará pantalones de dama y varón.
Una de las metas de Jocelyn son tener un local establecido en alguna feria libre, donde pueda trabajar cómodamente y atender a su clientela para que realice una compra satisfactoria.
Jocelyn vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es crecer cada dia para generar mayores ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, y a nivel personal y familiar darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
Ella está muy agradecida  y contenta de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le abrió una puerta laboral y le permitirá invertir en su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur. Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Delfines Emprendedores" and is composed of sixteen entrepreneurs, with different lines of work such as market vending, clothing sales, fast food sales, cleaning supplies sales, children clothes sales and services. They all live in the municipality of San Bernardo, located in the city of Santiago.

Jocelyn is a member of the communal bank. In the picture she is sitting in the second row, first from left to right. Her hair is dark brown, loose and she has bangs. She has been selling clothes for a year now. She sells door to door and her customers buy underwear, clothes for children and adults and shoes. She normally sells during paydays and she gives special credit conditions to her customers. When she needs more merchandise, she buys it in different establishments where she finds a wide variety of clothes, different colors, models and sizes and low prices, which is convenient for her.

With the loan, she will buy pants for women and men.

One of Jocelyn’s goals is to have an establishment in an outdoor market, where she can work comfortably and create a better buying experience for her customers. Jocelyn lives together with her husband and her two children, who are three and five years old. Her dreams, on a professional level, are to generate better income every day and to be able to give her family a better quality of life. On a personal and family level, she wants to give her children a good education.

She appreciates the opportunity given by Fondo Esperanza and she feels very happy, since it created a job opportunity that will help her to invest in her business and also in her own development. This experience has helped her to learn to be organized and to better distribute her income and investments.

San Bernardo is a city located 18 km south of Santiago. It is known as the folklore capital, because every year, in January, they organize the “International Folklore Festival”, an event in which different original cultures meet and music bands from all over South America play. They also organize the “Traditional Handicraft Fair”, where artisans from Chile and neighbor countries participate. In April, the event “Abril Cuecas Mil” [April, a thousand cuecas] is held, when all the municipality’s inhabitants dance cueca, a traditional Chilean dance.

loans.use: to buy pants for men and women.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 49 years old, married and the mother of two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for four years and is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Grece Lorena

texts.es: Anteriormente con su credikiva Grece compró muchos articulos con los cuales surtió su miscelanea de utiles escolares, ropa interior exterior e infantil, femenina y masculina, colonias, cremas y accesorios femeninos, con los que le fue muy bien; Hoy está aplicando  aun nuevo finaciamiento para cumplir su meta hacer adecuaciones a su vivienda, ampliando los espacios y de esta manera lograr para ella y su familia un ambiente confortable . Ella agradece la ayuda recibida y los felicita por la noble labor de apoyar gente humilde y trabajadora en todo el mundo. "
texts.en:
With the previous loan, Grece bought many items to stock her general store, including school supplies, underwear, outerwear, baby clothes, women's and men's clothing, cologne, beauty creams, and feminine accessories, with which she has done very well.

Today, she is applying for a new loan to achieve her goal of making improvements to her home, expanding the space and thereby giving her family a more comfortable environment to live in.  She is thankful for the help she has received and for the noble work of lending support to hardworking people of humble means around the world.

loans.use: to remodel her house.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong would like to take an additional loan to buy piglets, feed and to repair breeding facilities. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and improving sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy piglets, pig feed, and to repair her breeding facilities

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab, 40 years old, is married and has 2 children. He describes himself as a caring man. For the past year, Rajab has operated a store where he provides shoe repairs. His business is located in a busy business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Rajab will use this KES 10,000 loan to buy leather and shoes soles for repairing shoes and for making new shoes to sell. His business goal is to run at least three more similar outlets within 5 years. Rajab hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business with the help of SMEP DTM. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy leather and soles to make and repair shoes

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, se dedica a un taller de carpintería, está soltero, no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres, pero ya cuenta con su propia casa, él inicio hace 5 años con el negocio que es propio, lo aprendió de su padre, en ocasiones su dificultad es encontrar la madera seca. 
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de tablas, madera de laurel, maculis, pintura, pega, junco, y otros materiales que intervienen en la elaboración de muebles, este préstamo contribuirá a mejorar las cantidades de madera para hacerle frente a los pedidos.
Su aspiración es mejorar la producción, tener más maquinaria para ejercer el trabajo, y en un futuro continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Daniel has a carpentry workshop. He is unmarried and has no children. He lives with his parents and already has his own house. He started his business five years ago and it is his: he learned from his father. Occasionally he finds it difficult to obtain dry wood.

He is requesting a loan to purchase boards, laurel and maculis wood, paint, glue, reeds and other materials that are used in making furniture. This loan will contribute to improving his supply of wood so that he can meet his customers’ demands. His aspiration is to improve production, to have more machinery so he can do his work and in the future, to continue studying.

loans.use: to purchase laurel wood, maculis wood, paint, glue and reeds.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto tiene 52 años casado con un hijo de la edad de 13 años, el se dedica al comercio minorista, ofreciendo variedad de productos accesorios  para autos ya sea ambientador, fundas, el tiene un puesto de venta e n la zona de Cota Cota al sur de la ciudad de La paz, ofreciendo sus productos a los choferes,  tiene ya muchos clientes, El Sr. Roberto es cliente ya que este préstamo es el  segundo que solicito en la institución,  El Sr. Roberto va a usar este préstamo para la compra de artículos para autos al por mayor,  El Sr. Roberto enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención y comprando variedad de productos, El Sr. Roberto se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Roberto is 52 years old and married with one son, who is 13 years old. He is in retail trade, offering a variety of auto accessory products, whether it be air fresheners or seat covers. He has a sales stand in the Cota Cota area in the southern district of the city of La Paz. He sells to drivers and already has many customers.

This is St. Roberto’s second loan from Emprender. He will use it to purchase automobile accessories wholesale. He confronts challenges in his business such as the demand for new products and he will use the funding to be more attentive to the demand  by buying a variety of products. Roberto is happy and grateful to Emprender for its support and for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase auto accessories.

loans.name: James Alfos

texts.en:
James is a 42-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 5 children between the ages of 4 and 15; all of them go to school. James   runs a general store and has been in business for 3 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. 
James is taking a loan of 3,500ssp to purchase more cooking oil and other items. Besides this business, James has no other source of income.

In 5 years, James would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices.

James says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for buying more items like sugar, cooking oil, rice, etc.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi, who is 56, lives in the town of Kaloleni. She has now been running her shop for a number of years. The shop is situated in her home, which she has adapted to attract customers' attention. Her neighbours are complimentary both about her work and about Sidi as a person. She is well known and popular as she is a very friendly and hardworking woman, despite her old age. She has gained the trust of her neighbours who can see how she has bettered herself day by day.

Her dearest wish is to continue making an income from her business which, to date, has helped her to cover most of her household needs. She decided to apply for this loan to enable her to increase the stock for her shop, as she does not have the means to make such an investment on her own. The loan which she is seeking from Yehu will be used to buy a range of goods for the shop such as flour, oil, rice, sugar, beans, sweets and drinks. She wants to meet the growing market demand as this will allow her to increase her income, and provide better opportunities in life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a range of goods such as flour, oil, rice, sugar, beans, sweets and drinks for her shop.

loans.name: Jose Evenor

texts.es:
El señor José Evenor  tiene 63 años de edad. Vive en el municipio Chichigalpa, conocido por su producción de caña de azúcar y licorera. Es uno de los lugares más caliente de Nicaragua.

Desde hace 5 años le fue diagnosticado con una enfermedad.  el trabajo desde  su niñez en corte de caña de azúcar, riego y labores de campo.

 Al ser diagnosticado con esta, enfermedad a pesar de ser un hombre aun fuerte  no lo contratan para evitar gastos médicos. 
Actualmente viven de una pensión reducida  con la cual asume gastos familiares, cuenta con una pequeño negocio de subsistencia con el cual se apoya para cubrir gran parte de sus gastos médicos.

El se levanta a las 6 de la mañana todos los días a realizar sus labores cotidianas y posteriormente se dedica a la venta, cuando puede salir, ayuda e a su esposa a cobrar los pagos pendientes.

El destino del crédito es para cubrir gastos familiares e invertir en el negocio; en la compra de golosinas, chiverias, jabones.
texts.en:
José Evenor is 63 years old and lives in the town of Chichigalpa, which is known for its production of sugar cane and liquors. Chichigalpa is one of the hottest areas of Nicaragua. Five years ago, José was diagnosed with an illness. Since he was a young boy, José has worked in the fields, cutting sugar cane, watering the fields, and realizing other field labors.

Upon being diagnosed with this illness, despite still being strong, José stopped being hired because employers wanted to avoid medical expenses. Now, José lives off a reduced pension with which to pay his family's expenses. He relies on his small store to help him pay for his medical expenses. 

José begins working at 6 a.m. each day to start his daily duties and later he works in the store. When he can leave, he helps his wife collect outstanding payments. 

José will use this loan to cover his family expenses and to invest in his business to purchase candies, dairy products, and soaps to sell.

loans.use: to buy candy, dairy products, soaps, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a resident of Kongowea of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four children, all of whom attend school.  Beatrice owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for eight years. Besides this, Beatrice also owns a cereals shop and rental houses.

She learnt about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is bad debts and fluctuating prices. 

Beatrice is applying for a loan of 43,100 Kenya shillings to purchase food stuff like cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of the family. She aspires to own other centers and pay for her children’s education with much security.

loans.use: To purchase food stuff like cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en: Quyen would like to take an additional loan to buy piglets, pig feed and to repair breeding facilities. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and improving sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy piglets, pig feed and to  repair breeding facilities

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 39 years old, married, and has six children. She has had a  hand embroidery business of for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. 

Business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate Shamim nearly every day. Her husband drives a loader rickshaw in the local market but he does not earn enough to support the family. Shamim aimed to look after her family with a supporting hand and started the business of embroidery in her house. Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

Two of Shamim 's daughters help her to complete her orders on time. She teaches embroidery skills to some of the girls in her colony. She wants to expand her business so she is requesting a loan for 15,000 PKR, which she will use to buy raw materials such as spools of thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities and different colors to meet the increasing demand. 

Shamim dreams of running a training center for girls in her colony. She would teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business and also earn money for themselves. Shamim is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as spools of thread, sequins, and pearls.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc would like to take out another loan to purchase more products such as cloth, needles and thread to stock her store. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more products, such as cloth, needles and thread, to stock her store.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 44 years old, is married to Evaline and the father of three lovely children. He has operated a general store in Kangemi for twelve years, earning a monthly income of 40,000 KES (Kenya shillings).

This will be Peter's first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy stock, such as sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking fat, etc. for his shop. Peter wants to open a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock, such as sugar, maize flour, rice, etc. for resale

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai would like to take out another loan to buy more products, such as cloth, needles and thread, to stock her store. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more products, such as cloth, needles and thread, to stock her store.

loans.name: Lua

texts.en: Lua would like to take out another loan to buy equipment and materials to produce bedding, including mattresses, blankets and pillows, to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy equipment and materials to produce bedding

loans.name: Tien

texts.en: Tien is requesting a new loan to buy materials and equipment to increase his production of machine parts. Tien's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing his sales. He also hopes that, through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials and equipment to increase his production

loans.name: Thom

texts.en: Thom is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products, such as food and beverages, to sell in her general store. This loan will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. She used a previous loan to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and her sales, and also help her improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 56-year-old man, he is married and a father to four sons and two daughter. One of his sons is employed and one of his daughters is a university student.

For the past ten years, Jamal has been working in medicinal herbs that customers usually use to be treated for seasonal illnesses such as cold, cough, etc. He has a good reputation among his customers, which makes his project a profitable one with good customer demand in all seasons.

Jamal is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a collection of medicinal herbs that customers often request and buy. This will increase sales and improve Jamal's income positively.

Jamal is photographed inside his store.

loans.use: To purchase medicinal herbs for sale

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is requesting a new loan to buy furniture and food to sell at her food stall. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her continue to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through this loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy furniture and food for her food stall.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Diep would like to take out a new loan to buy more cows to rear and use to make milk to sell. Her previous loan allowed her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through this new loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cows to raise and make milk to sell.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products, such as food and beverages, to sell in her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. She used a previous loan her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that this new loan will allow her to increase the size of her store along with her sales, and that this will help her improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products, such as food and beverages, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Luc

texts.en: Luc, 45, is married and has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife started a general store ten years ago, selling instant foods such as noodles and fried potatoes, and households items for people in his community. Luc is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of products to sell in his store and to better satisfy his customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase instant food and household items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Ms Zahida is a 39-year-old widow who has been doing stitching work for many years. She adopted stitching as a profession after her husband's death. Zahida knows the techniques of stitching very well, so decided to use her skills in a productive manner. Being a single parent, she needs to fulfill her children's needs. She has 3 children, all under 18, and she has no other source of income. Through her hard work, Zahida is trying to fulfill her responsibilities regarding education and the basics of life.

To cope with the increasing demand for her products, Zahida has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase reels of threads in different colors and another sewing machine for her daughter to assist her in her free time. Zahida dreams of providing her children with a better and prosperous future. She is hopeful of earning more profits and intends to use part of this loan on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase reels of threads and another sewing machine

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old, married, and has four children. He runs a butcher shop, which he has been doing for two years.  He earns a monthly income of  4,750  KES. 

John is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD for 9,000 KES, which he will use to acquire more meat and also produce smokies for sale. With the anticipated income, John will open up a new stall. His future plan is to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more meat.

loans.name: Zaida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Zaida es originaria de Masaya, reside en esta cuidad desde hace 34 años, es casada, tiene 57 años de edad.

 Su  negocio consiste en la elaboración de calzado, con el apoyo de su esposo han logrado salir adelante porque entre los dos han puesto su mayor esfuerzo para que su negocio prospere y se sienten satisfecho con los resultados, específicamente  ellos elaboran  el diseño  de botas militares habiendo adquirido habilidad en su fabricación. 

Su núcleo familiar es de 5, tres hijos y su esposo (hijos mayores de edad).

Solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima, ya que ella tiene pedidos importantes en esta época del año, que es cuando se mejoran las ventas.

 la señora Zaida cuenta con una clientela a la que le distribuye en puntos de ventas como lo es el mercado Oriental y en el mercado.

Con el financiamiento pretende comprar  materiales de zapatería, cuero, pega blanca y amarilla, galleta negra, royal, suela estándar, cinta verde, remaches, cordones.
texts.en:
Zaida is from Masaya, she has lived in this city for 34 years, married, is 57 years old.
Her business consists in the manufacturing of shoes, with support from her husband, she has been able to get ahead because between the two of them they have put their best effort into making the business grow and they feel satisfied with the results; they specifically design and make  military boots and have acquired an ability in the manufacturing process.
Her family is formed by five members, three children and her husband (adult children).
She requests a loan to buy materials, she has important orders to fill at this time of the year when sales get better.  Zaida has a client base that she distributes to at points of sale such as the Oriental and local markets.  With the loan she plans to buy shoe making materials such as leather, white and yellow glue, standard soles, green tape, parts, laces.

loans.use: to buy shoe making materials such as leather, white and yellow glue, standard soles, green tape, parts, laces.

loans.name: Felix Armando

texts.es: El sr. Félix, es un cliente antiguo, el sigue con la actividad de confección de chamarras y los vende en el interior (Oruro y Potosí) el sr  Félix, es un cliente muy trabajador, joven  con mucha experiencia, hace 11 años que inicio su actividad y oficio, con la confección de chamarras, razón por la cual llegó a equipar su taller con todos los equipos necesarios, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito que saco para la compra de una maquina collareta industrial, incremento su produccion y tambien la demanda de sus productos, en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de un equipo industrial de corte y tela por mayor ya que tiene muchos pedidos que entregar y esto le facilitara el trabajo.
texts.en:
Félix is a longstanding client who works making jackets that he sells in the center of the country (Oruro and Potosí). He is a hardworking, experienced young man. He began making jackets 11 years ago, so he has outfitted his workshop with the necessary equipment. 

He used his previous loan to buy an industrial collaring machine and increased his production along with the growing demand for his products. Now he is requesting a loan to buy an industrial cutting machine and fabrics in bulk because he has many orders to fill and this will help him with the work.

loans.use: to buy an industrial cutting machine and fabrics in bulk.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City. To make a living, Richel raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn to sell. Richel has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

Richel joined GDMPC in 2008.  She is requesting a loan of 9,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Soi

texts.en:
Soi would like to take an additional loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes, mosquito nets, blankets, mats, and pillows to sell from her stall. 

Soi's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and improving sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes, mosquito nets, blankets, mats, and pillows

loans.name: Tien

texts.en: Tien would like to take an additional loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of rice to sell from her stall. Tien's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and improving sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of rice to sell

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien is requesting a new loan to buy sewing materials and another scooter to provide her with transport for her business (as the scooter she bought with the previous loan was stolen). Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality sewing materials and a scooter for transport.

loans.name: Tamila

texts.en:
Tamila is from the Khoni district of West Georgia. She is 61 years old, widowed, and lives with her adult son. Tamila is provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they run small dairy farm of 2 calves and 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local open market. Besides dairy farming, Tamila grows maize on the family-owned agricultural land and sells the harvested products for a good price. In addition, the family owns a vineyard and produces wine and vodka with the harvested grapes. They have three pigs as well and sell piglets seasonally.

Tamila works hard to do her best for her family. She wants to make some improvements and repairs to her old house but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she is requesting a loan to cover the costs of repairing the house such as changing windows, painting, etc. Taking this loan will create for Tamila and her family suitable home conditions and enable them to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to renovate the house

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 22 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her one child who is in school.

Margie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Margie has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Margie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, eggs,  groceries, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: An

texts.en: An is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food and beverages for selling at his stall. An's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy better quality food and beverages to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Ne'ma

texts.en:
Ne'ma is 52 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband is a worker who earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs. Ne'ma is preparing wedding requirements for her son who will marry soon, but the amount of money she has is not enough to cover all the costs. 

Ne'ma is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture in order to improve living conditions of her son and his bride. Ne'ma is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in her Kiva profile photo.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending help text at http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nelly works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a welding shop. Nelly is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock like shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell for her ready-to-wear business.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling lumber in the Philippines. Nenita has been in this business for 11 years now. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional wood for her business.

In the future, Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood for her business.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 37 years old, is married and has a daughter. Her husband is a goods deliverer and the family lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Thuy has been running a business making cloth for selling. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her child.

Thuy is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more scraps of fabric to make a greater quantity of cloth for selling. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her business turnover. Thuy hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy scraps of fabric to make cloth for selling.

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enhtsetseg, 25 years old, lives with her husband and 2 children in their own small house in Sainshand soum of Dornogobi province, Mongolia. Her husband, Tserenbat, aged 25, provides a taxi service business to local customers. Enhtsetseg's children stay home with their grandparents during the day.

Enhtsetseg graduated from a manufacturing and specialty training center as a chef in 2007. She has been working as an assistant chef and chef for a small cafeteria since then. She is now planning to open her own cafe in a good location where a shopping center and schools are located. Enhtsetseg has estimated her potential income and profit, which would be enough to cover family expenses and save a little for her children's future. She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase equipment and inventory for her new cafeteria business. Enhtsetseg is a hardworking, responsible and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and inventory for her new cafeteria business

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung, 42, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with his family, including two daughters, one son and his wife. Dung and his wife earn their income through their business selling pork and noodles for people in the community. Dung would like to get a loan to buy a better quality of food and ingredients to provide good meals for his customers. He also hopes his business will ensure that his family members, and especially his children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy better quality food and ingredients.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Ms. Razia is a 48-year-old, married woman and a mother of three. She has been in the business of selling clothes for many years. She is famous for providing formal, bridal dresses for occasions like weddings, engagements, etc.. At this time she has retained many customers. Her husband is employed in a small retail store but his income alone is not sufficient to bear daily expenditures of his family members. Razia is highly contributing to the family income to support her family through all her hard work. Her customer base is diverse and varied. She is much in demand and highly appreciated among her customers. However, due to low cash in hand, she is facing difficulties in fulfilling the orders of her customers on time. For this, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of clothes, in large quantity to add to her new ones. This will attract many customers, sales will improve and profit margin will also increase. She intends to utilize a part of her income on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy a wide variety of clothes, in large quantity to add to her new ones.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Niedes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Niedes earns more income from pig fattening, food vending and a general store. She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell for her banana business.

Niedes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Goojnii

texts.en:
Goojnii is 57 years old, married, and has two adult children.  She lives in Orkhon province, Mongolia. Her husband helps her operate her organic dairy products sales business, which she has been doing since 2000 at the local market. She buys organic dairy products from herders and sells them to local customers at a retail price. She has gained a lot of experience and customers over the years. 

Goojnii is requesting a loan for 1,'000,'000 MNT, which she will use to reserve organic dairy products to sell during the winter when dairy products production reaches the lowest level of the year.

loans.use: to reserve organic dairy products to sell during the winter.

loans.name: Camal

texts.en:
Camal is a motivated, 60-year-old married man with four children. In order to provide his family with all of the necessities, he started a taxi service business 22 years ago. His wife receives a 100 AZN pension that helps with their communal expenses. He has an individual approach to each customer, and this is why he has many clients. 

In the future Camal would like to purchase a new car, but he realizes that he has a responsibility to his family and has therefore delayed his new car purchase. Today he has applied for a home repair loan. He will rebuild the terrace of his house, which creates a poor and risky condition for his family.

loans.use: To rebuild the terrace of his house.

loans.name: Mauline

texts.en:
Mauline is 28 years old. She is married and blessed with two children that she supports. She has run a general store for the past three years, making a monthly income of KES 20,000.
